text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with grilled brie and pear sandwich
that's right
April 12th is national grilled cheese
sandwich day and to celebrate I'm going
to show you my favorite alternative
grilled cheese sandwich on by the way
shouldn't National grilled cheese
sandwich day be on the 20th but anyway
like I said this is my favorite non
traditional grilled cheese sandwich and
it goes a little something like this and
for step 1 here we're going to go ahead
and prep our pears and to do that we're
going to go ahead and cut them in half
and then I actually like to remove the
seeds and trim them up a little bit with
this a melon baller which I think works
very well so I'm gonna take out the
seeds like that I want to go ahead and
remove that little thing at the bottom
and of course the stem at the top and
then there's a little kind of fibrous
thing that runs down to where the seeds
were so I like to scrape that out a
little bit and sure you can just do that
with a paring knife but the melon baller
does make this very easy although I
guess if we're using it for this it's
actually a pear baller but regardless if
you use this tool no one can deny that
you're a baller so you got that going
for you and then after the pear has been
cut and prepped as shown we're going to
go ahead and slice it like this and yes
I do like to eat the first piece for
good luck and then we'll go ahead and
slice these up maybe about an eighth of
an inch thick something like that and
this beautiful brown variety I'm using
is called a Bosc pear it's my favorite
so that looks pretty good and I'll save
those three smaller pieces for a snack
time
oh it's neck time so sweet delicious but
anyway we're going to slice up some pear
and then we're going to need to of
course slice up some bread so I'm going
to take a beautiful round loaf of French
bread and please do something beautiful
and crusty by the way this was a day old
so it was a little harder to cut but
because I'm using a nice sharp serrated
knife it wasn't that bad so day-old
bread definitely is going to work here
and really the sandwich is only going to
be as good as the bread you use all
right I have nothing against
supermarkets I've spent half my adult
life in them but when you're doing a
special sandwich like this it's
definitely worth the extra effort to
make the trip to the Bellagio but anyway
I'm going to cut two nice thick slices
not too thick about 1/2 inch is probably
perfect and once our bread is sliced we
are going to butter it now two things to
note here
make sure your two slices of bread or
mirror images and that instruction will
only make sense if you do it wrong and
then the second thing here is be very
generous with the butter if someone is
actually watching you spread that butter
on it should be slightly embarrassing
now having said that even though that
looks like a ton
it's actually not that much okay for the
most authentic version of this sandwich
you'd actually use more than that but
we'll be semi health-conscious and only
use too much and not weigh too much and
then once that bread has been buttered
we're going to go ahead and put it
butter side down and a skillet set on
medium heat and we will start to build
this amazing sandwich so our breads
going our pears have been sliced and the
last major ingredient we need is some
brie cheese and leave that in the fridge
until the last second it's much much
easier to slice cold and we'll go ahead
and start cutting off some slices not
too thick not too thin try to make them
perfect and we'll go ahead and lay that
down on both sides of the bread now you
don't need total coverage on both sides
because when you press this together any
gaps will be filled but we are going to
put on a nice healthy portion so we're
gonna go ahead and place down our brie
and then a couple not-so-secret
ingredients that really make this
sandwich first of all would be some
freshly cracked black pepper which may
seem a little odd on a fruit and cheese
sandwich but it's not it's not at all
and then in addition to the pepper we'll
also do a few little freshly picked
thyme leaves oh you know I got a time
plan the garden and so should you so I'm
gonna pick over a few leaves maybe a
dozen I didn't count them and at that
point we're ready for a layer a pair so
just go ahead and lay out your pear
slices all right kind of in a single
layer but you can overlap a little if
you want you see me breaking those
slices up to fill any gaps and if you're
feeling a little wild you can even tuck
one in and then one last touch before we
sandwich this up I'm going to give it a
tiny tiny pinch of salt and that's
really going to bring out the sweetness
in the pear at that point we're gonna go
ahead and take the non pear side and
flip it over on to the top make sure you
line it up perfectly I mean who the heck
wants to eat a misalign sandwich so get
it straight and I'm pretty sure you guys
know the rest of this I'm going to grill
that sandwich on both sides until that
buttery bread is beautifully brown and
crispy and of course the cheese inside
is heated through and oozy and melty and
yes of course if you have one of those
sandwich presses you could use that for
this I have one of those little panini
machines down in the garage
I think it's next to my pressure cooker
and my wok but anyway the pan method
works perfectly as you can see but
anyway like I said we're going to
continue grilling that on both sides
until beautifully browned and heated
through and right about here I decided
mine was perfect so we're going to pull
that out of the pan throw it on the
cutting board and then as my
good friend jay-z once said turn the
music up in the headphones and listen to
this oh yeah and I would not blame you
if you ate it right off the cutting
board just like that but of course I got
to make mine presentable so I threw down
a plate with some obligatory greens I
snapped a few pictures and I quickly
lost interest in any photography because
I did not want to eat this cold so let
me tear into this thing yes more
crunching sounds and that my friends is
one of the world's great grilled cheese
sandwich experiences I mean just french
bread fried and butter is an incredibly
awesome thing but when that crunchy
buttery bread is also stuffed with warm
gooey brie and sweet fast pears that
have been ever so lightly scented with
thyme and black pepper
I mean I'm tempted to learn French just
so I can describe this properly okay so
there you go grilled brie and pear
sandwich we don't really do a lot of
sandwich videos even though I get a ton
of requests for them I guess because
every time I do and it feels like I'm
taking the day off but in this case I
made an exception and what a
magnificently and fantastically
delicious exception it is so I really do
hope you give this a try head over to
food wishes calm for all the ingredient
amounts and more info as usual and as
always enjoy
you
